author: Walt Disney
text: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
text: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.

author: Albert Einstein
text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.

author: Nelson Mandela
text: It always seems impossible until it is done.

author: Steve Jobs
text: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life.

author: Helen Keller
text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.

author: Mark Twain
text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.

author: Confucius
text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

author: Maya Angelou
text: You will face many defeats in life, but never let yourself be defeated.

author: Henry Ford
text: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you're right.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.

author: Vincent van Gogh
text: I dream my painting and I paint my dream.

author: Mother Teresa
text: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.

author: Buddha
text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
text: Learning never exhausts the mind.

author: J.K. Rowling
text: It is our choices, far more than our abilities, that show what we truly are.

author: Dalai Lama
text: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.

author: Aristotle
text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.

author: Jane Austen
text: It is not what we have, but what we enjoy, that constitutes our abundance.

author: Charles Dickens
text: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.

author: Rumi
text: The wound is the place where the Light enters you.

author: Pablo Picasso
text: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once we grow up.

author: Nelson Mandela
text: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.

author: Albert Camus
text: In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer.

author: Virginia Woolf
text: For most of history, Anonymous was a woman.

author: Simone de Beauvoir
text: One is not born, but rather becomes.

author: George Orwell
text: In a time of deceit telling the truth is a revolutionary act.

author: Margaret Mead
text: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.

author: Malala Yousafzai
text: I raise up my voiceâ€”not so that I can shout, but so that those without a voice can be heard.

author: Audrey Hepburn
text: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!
